isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - DRIVE GEAR NUT AND FRONT BEARING COVER

svcproc.title: DRIVE GEAR NUT AND FRONT BEARING COVER

step1.para: Apply Loctite 277 sealant to cleaned threads of new drive gear bearing nut ( Figure 411). DO NOT REUSE OLD NUT.

figure.caption: Figure 410. Apply Sealant to Cleaned Threads of New Drive Gear Bearing Nut

note.para: For models equipped with a snap ring to retain bearing, install the snap ring in the groove of the input shaft and proceed to Step 4.

step1.para: Engage two mainshaft sliding clutches into gear to prevent transmission from rotating ( Figure 412).

figure.caption: Figure 411. Engage Two Mainshaft Sliding Clutches into Gear

step1.para: Install the nut on the shaft (left hand threads) ( Figure 413). Using a drive gear nut installer, tighten to 250 to 300 ft-lbs. (339 to 407 Nm). Use a punch and maul to peen the nut into the two milled slots of the input shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 412. Install Nut on Shaft and Tighten

step1.para: If previously removed, install the oil seal in the drive gear bearing cover of models so equipped ( Figure 414).

figure.caption: Figure 413. Install Oil Seal in Drive Gear Bearing Cover

step1.para: Install the drive gear bearing cover and gasket, making sure to align the oil return hole in the case ( Figure 415). Secure the cover on the case with retaining bolts (inset). Apply Loctite 242 to the bolt threads and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 414. Install Drive Gear Bearing Cover and Gasket
